SET_UP_TEXT: This application is a demonstration of a GitHub Action that translates JSON files. You can find the source code on GitHub.
GETTING_STARTED_TEXT:
Welcome to the translator app! Select a language from the dropdown above to get started.

This application allows you to quickly switch between different languages to see how content is translated. Explore the features and enjoy a seamless multilingual experience.
USAGE_TEXT: Here is an example of how to use the translator in your project.
AWS_CREDENTIALS_TEXT:
To use the translator, you need to provide AWS credentials. You can do this by setting them as secrets in your GitHub repository. The workflow expects the following secrets:

- `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`
- ``AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`

Alternatively, you can configure AWS credentials directly in your workflow file if you prefer not to use secrets.

For more information on setting up AWS credentials, refer to the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-javascript/v2/developer-guide/setting-credentials-node.html).
